It is characterized by its delicate, bi-lobed fronds that are typically divided into narrow, linear segments. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce numerous small, spore-bearing sorus clusters on the underside of the fronds. Diplazium longisorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
